means: 做手势，做示意动作，手势

sentence.Network_en: They shout and gesticulate tremendously but cannot agree.
sentence.Network_cn: 他俩指手划脚,大吵大闹,相持不下.

sentence.Network_en: If China conforms to this condition, I thought nobody dares to Chinato gesticulate.
sentence.Network_cn: 如果中国符合这个条件, 我想没有人敢对中国指手画脚.

sentence.Network_en: Now, we should see for ourselves if we gesticulate more righty than lefty.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在我们需要看看我们人类自己是否用右手做手势的时候多于用左手的时候.

when be together with him , do not make too tender gesticulation and motion .和他在一起时，不要做过于温柔的手势和动作。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin gesticulat- 'gesticulated', from the verb gesticulari, from gesticulus, diminutive of gestus 'action'

entry.tran: 做手势；用手势表达；用动作示意
entry.def: If you gesticulate, you make movements with your arms or hands, often while you are describing something that is difficult to express in words.

example.ex: A man with a paper hat upon his head was gesticulating wildly...
example.tran: 一个戴纸帽的男子在拼命地打手势。

example.ex: The architect was gesticulating at a hole in the ground.
example.tran: 那位建筑师在指着地上的一个洞打手势。

means.word_mean: 1. show, express or direct through movement;

auth_sentence.content: It was natural when one spoke French to gesticulate, to indicate his men with a wave of the hand.
auth_sentence.res_content: It was natural when one spoke French to gesticulate, to indicate his men with a wave of the hand.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It was natural when one spoke French to gesticulate, to indicate his men with a wave of the hand.

sentences.en: He gesticulated wildly as he tried to make her understand.
sentences.cn: 他使劲向她做着手势，试图让她明白。

sentences.en: The officer gesticulated towards the refugees.
sentences.cn: 那官员朝难民做着手势。
